alert.note: Alert for Phillips; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 06 at 10:35PM CDT by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Smith, Phillips, southwestern Franklin and southeastern Harlan Counties through 1100 PM CDT... At 1034 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Huntley to 7 miles south of Woodruff to near Logan. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Republican City and Huntley around 1040 PM CDT. Naponee around 1045 PM CDT. Glade around 1050 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Bloomington, Franklin, Agra and Kirwin. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. Persons in campgrounds should consider seeking sturdy shelter until these storms pass. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for north central Kansas...and south central Nebraska.
